summary: "Wuthering Heights" is a classic novel written by Emily BrontÃ« in 1847. It tells the story of two families, the Earnshaws and Lintons, and their complicated relationships with Heathcliff, a foster son. The book is set on the wild moors of West Yorkshire, England, and is known for its romantic and gothic style. It was controversial when first published due to its depictions of cruelty and challenges to Victorian values. Today, it's considered one of the best English novels, inspiring many adaptations, including a famous song by Kate Bush.
title: Wuthering Heights
